intro: Marrubium pallidum, commonly known as pale horehound, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has a creeping habit with upright flowering stems, and its leaves are often aromatic and slightly mucilaginous. Marrubium pallidum is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
